responses.rationale: Factual reporting of event ('mass culling') and consequence ('impacts food prices') without explicit framing rhetoric.
Factual reporting including technical term ('highly pathogenic') which is ignored by TECH_TERM_GUARD.
Factual description of virus spread rate ('spreading quickly') without explicit amplification for alarm.
Reports expert concern ('raising concern') which is Neutral by context guard, and potential transmission factually.
Factual statement about virus transmission method.
Factual description of virus characteristics ('highly contagious', 'spread easily', 'mutates') without explicit framing.
Factual reporting of cases appearing in expected locations ('predictably begun popping up').
Factual reporting of confirmed cases in specific locations and types of flocks.
Factual description of spread ('spreads easily') and potential severity ('can prove deadly').
Factual description of actions taken ('quarantined', 'depopulated', 'prevent the spread').
Factual background information about animal models in research.
Factual background and historical context ('important to remember that we've been somewhere like this before') without explicit framing.
Factual historical reporting.
Factual biographical/historical information.
Factual biographical information.
Uses a descriptive metaphor ('multi-act play') and reports factual trends ('lengthening list') without explicit framing.
Uses a descriptive metaphor and asks about potential future implications ('portends') without explicit framing.
Neutral quote stating plausibility.
Factual description of reporting process and topic of inquiry ('level of concern') without amplification.
Uses a descriptive phrase ('raised the specter') and reports a historical event factually.
Factual historical reporting of virus spread.
Reports a quote expressing personal concern ('what worries me') and describes scientific observations factually.
Reports a quote containing a certain prediction ('for sure') of a negative event ('new pandemic') without explicit amplification of the event's severity.
Reports an opinion/recommendation factually.
Factual biographical/historical information.
Reports a quote containing factual information about other viruses and their potential impacts ('severe lower respiratory tract infection and fatal outcomes').
Factual statement ('you will find swine influenza viruses') with a descriptive phrase ('really big picture perspective').
Reports a quote expressing personal concern ('worries about') factually.
Reports a quote expressing personal concern ('gives me a pit in my stomach') and lack of optimism factually.
Factual reporting of lobbying activity.
Factual list of organizations.
Contains explicit Alarmist framing: 'particularly acute' (intensifier + risk-adjective).
Contains explicit Alarmist framing: 'hit particularly hard' (intensifier + negative impact description).
Neutral question.
Factual description of geographic spread and resulting concern ('has raised concerns') which is Neutral by context guard.
Factual description of symptoms/impacts ('sudden increase in the mortality', 'drop in egg production').
Factual reporting of actions taken by countries in response to an outbreak.
Reports a quote containing a factual comparison of geographic spread ('certainly seeing more geographic spread').
Neutral question.
Factual statement about a factor contributing to spread.
Factual statement about a factor contributing to spread.
Factual reporting of symptoms in birds ('complete paralysis', 'swelling', 'twisting').
Factual reporting of cases and a likely consequence ('posing a likely threat') without amplification.
Factual historical reporting of outbreaks ('large outbreaks') and spread ('spread throughout the world').
Factual reporting of case locations and types of flocks.
Factual reporting of consequences (export restrictions).
Factual reporting of consequences (limiting purchases).
Factual reporting of consequences (banning or limiting imports).
Factual statistical information, attributed to a source.
Factual reporting of case locations, dates, and types of birds, attributed to a source.
Factual reporting of case location, date, and type of bird.
Factual scientific description.
Factual reporting of geographic and temporal spread.
Factual reporting of geographic scope of outbreaks ('dealing with avian flu').
Factual reporting of an outbreak, government action, and detection, including technical term ('highly pathogenic').
Factual description of action taken ('tightened controls').
Reports the existence and cause of fear ('new fear is driven by') factually (Neutral by context guard).
Reports a quote containing a factual assessment of risk level ('definitely considered a period of high risk').
Factual reporting of a confirmed case ('hit with avian flu').
Factual reporting of confirmed cases ('hit with bird flu').
Factual statement about transmission method and timing.
Factual reporting of a non-statement.
Factual list of case locations and types of flocks.
Factual statement about an article update and clarification.
Factual reporting of a confirmed infection, including technical term ('highly pathogenic').
Factual reporting of a finding, attributed to a source.
Factual historical reporting of an outbreak and its impact.
Reports a quote containing factual information about risk ('can cross species and infect humans') and rarity ('is rare').
Factual description of transmission pathways.
Factual description of transmission pathways ('can happen').
Factual description of conditions for transmission.
Factual description of illness severity range ('ranges from mild to severe').
Factual reporting of a case and its rarity ('rare case').
Factual statement about reasons for concern ('are concerning') which is Neutral by context guard.
Factual statistical information, attributed to a source.
Factual reporting of a confirmed case, location, and date.
Neutral quote expressing an opinion.
Factual reporting of a confirmed infection, attributed to a source.
Factual historical reporting of outbreaks ('large outbreaks') and spread ('spread throughout the world').
Factual reporting of confirmed cases and resulting psychological state ('reigniting fears') which is Neutral by context guard.
Factual statement about potential impact ('high mortality rates').
Factual reporting of detection, attributed to a source.
Factual reporting of a non-disclosure.
Factual reporting of a positive test result.
Factual reporting of detection, including technical term ('highly pathogenic').
Factual reporting of detection location and characteristics ('small, non-commercial'), attributed to a source.
Factual reporting of temporal sequence of detections.
Factual reporting of case locations and types of flocks, attributed to a source.

Factual reporting of cases, including technical term ('highly pathogenic').
Factual reporting of a case.
Neutral quote about business practice.
Factual statement about potential severity ('can be deadly') and spread characteristic ('spread rapidly').
Reports a reaction ('ignited protests') factually (Neutral by context guard).
Factual reporting of an event (protest).
Factual historical reporting of first appearance and location.
Factual statement about non-relation to another pathogen, attributed to a source.
Factual reporting of spread pattern ('very clearly on the wings'), attributed to a source.
Factual statement about a trend/potential ('opportunities...has increased'), attributed to a source.
Factual statement about findings in animals, attributed to a source.
Neutral quote stating a factual observation.

Factual statement about genetic characteristics and lack of association with human infection.
Factual description of spread ('spreads easily') and potential severity ('can prove deadly').

Reports a quote about the reason for confidence based on factual findings.
Factual reporting of expert skepticism ('increasingly skeptical') and reason ('ground the virus continues to gain').
Factual reporting of survey findings.
Reports a quote stating a possibility ('raise the possibility') based on findings.
Neutral quote stating something is a hypothesis.
Neutral quote stating something is a hypothesis and requires investigation.
Neutral quote stating something is a hypothesis and requires investigation, emphasizing it's 'at this point'.
Factual description of symptoms in human cases ('conjunctivitis').
Factual statement about challenges ('underscored some of the challenges').
Factual description of a situation/difficulty ('had a hard time').
Factual description of a situation ('whipping up') and potential for spread ('can carry the virus').
Reports a quote stating a factual assessment ('not optimal').
Factual reporting of cases and locations, describing scale ('sizeable bird flu cases').
Factual statement about a challenge ('difficult to keep out').
Factual scientific statement.
Factual scientific description ('close cousin'), attributed to a source.
Neutral quote discussing scientific hypothesis.
Reports a quote stating something is a concern ('it's a concern') which is Neutral by context guard.
Factual reporting of circumstances of illness, attributed to a source.
Factual statement about case severity ('are mild').
Factual statement about frequency ('Most people') and symptom ('pink eye').
Factual statement about the affected group.
Factual statement about risk ('real risk') without explicit amplification of realised impact.
Factual historical reporting of first report and location.
Factual reporting of confirmed cases and location.
Reports a quote stating a situation is concerning ('was concerning') which is Neutral by context guard.
Factual reporting of symptoms in animals ('difficulty breathing', 'coughing').
Factual description of symptoms in birds ('Lethargy', 'spasms').
Contains explicit Alarmist framing: 'particularly vulnerable' (intensifier + risk-adjective).
Factual statement about susceptibility ('are susceptible') based on historical outbreaks.
Factual statement about unique species and unknown consequences ('consequences...are unknown'), including technical term ('highly pathogenic').
Factual statement about potential impacts ('negative effects', 'vast numbers', 'long-term ecosystem effects').
Factual statement about difficulty ('challenging to record').
Reports a quote stating factual difficulties ('hard to estimate', 'huge', 'a lot').
Factual statement about increased difficulty ('even harder').
Factual statement about an article amendment.
Factual statement about human infection frequency ('rare') and conditions ('can occur').

Factual statement comparing virus strains and reporting spread ('spread rapidly').

Factual headline reporting animal deaths ('KILLS 47 TIGERS, 3 LIONS AND A PANTHER').
Factual statement about virus presence ('widespread') and outbreaks ('ongoing outbreaks'), attributed to a source.
Factual reporting of number of human cases.
Factual headline reporting a specific type of human case ('FIRST CASE...WITHOUT EXPOSURE').
Factual description of human symptoms ('mild flu-like upper respiratory symptoms', 'difficulty breathing').
Factual reporting of animal deaths, location, and test results.
Factual headline reporting detection and locations.
Factual reporting of number of states affected, attributed to a source.
Factual reporting of number of outbreaks and types of flocks in a specific location.
Factual reporting of new cases, locations, and geographic scope ('spread to more than 30 states').
Factual reporting of past policy and reasoning ('worried that') which is Neutral by context guard.
Factual reporting of negative impact ('Trading has suffered') and reason.
Factual reporting of a farm being affected ('hit by'), including technical term ('highly pathogenic').
Factual scientific statement.
Factual reporting of number of affected farms/flocks and states.
Contains evaluative language ('Less reassuring') but does not explicitly amplify negative facts about the virus or its impact.
Factual statement about trial results being watched ('closely watched') and previous data quality ('data...was mixed').
Factual reporting of a statement about an issue and lack of contracts.
Neutral quote stating a position/reasoning.
Factual reporting of animal deaths ('died') and status ('endangered birds').
Contains explicit Alarmist framing: 'only 334' (quantifier emphasizing the low number of endangered birds).
Factual statement about a likely factor ('likely that') in spread, attributed to a source.
Factual statement about historical pattern vs current trend ('spreading for a longer period').
Factual reporting of detection, strain, location, and novelty ('for the first time'), including technical term ('highly pathogenic').
Factual reporting of a positive test result, location, and date, attributed to a source.
Factual report of an outbreak, virus movement, and impact (sickening and killing) without explicit framing cues.
Reports a reaction ('gives flu researchers pause') which is treated as neutral per psychological verb guard.
Factual statement about the difficulty of assessment without explicit framing cues.
Factual statement about the virus's capability, defaulting to neutral per Q8/Q12.
Factual report of historical animal deaths without explicit framing cues.
Factual report of historical detections of infections without explicit framing cues.
Quote expressing past experience metaphorically, without explicit framing cues.
Factual report of dead and sick birds being reported without explicit framing cues.
Factual description of a person and activity without explicit framing cues.
Factual description of people and location/time without explicit framing cues.
Factual description of a person and situation without explicit framing cues.
Factual report of a case, described factually as 'rare severe case', without explicit framing cues.
Factual statement about origin without explicit framing cues.
Factual report of prevalence ('Many, even most') attributed to a source, without explicit framing cues.
Factual, technical description of the virus and a process without explicit framing cues.
Reports what someone worries about, treated as neutral per psychological verb guard.
Quote stating a prediction factually ('a new pandemic for sure') without explicit framing cues.
